alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Highlands; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 10:42PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches except between 3 and 5 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph producing blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-25 and I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
